item.title: Hunters International ransomware shuts down after World Leaks rebrand
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Hunters International Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation announced today that it has officially closed down its operations and will offer free decryptors to help victims recover their data without paying a ransom. [...]

item.title: Microsoft asks users to ignore Windows Firewall config errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft asked customers this week to disregard incorrect Windows Firewall errors that appear after rebooting their systems following the installation of the June 2025 preview update. [...]

item.title: NimDoor crypto-theft macOS malware revives itself when killed
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: North Korean state-backed hackers have been using a new family of macOS malware called NimDoor in a campaign that targets web3 and cryptocurrency organizations. [...]

item.title: DOJ investigates ex-ransomware negotiator over extortion kickbacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An ex-ransomware negotiator is under criminal investigation by the Department of Justice for allegedly working with ransomware gangs to profit from extortion payment deals. [...]

item.title: Spain arrests hackers who targeted politicians and journalists
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Spanish police have arrested two individuals in the province of Las Palmas for their alleged involvement in cybercriminal activity, including data theft from the country's government. [...]

item.title: Cisco warns that Unified CM has hardcoded root SSH credentials
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Cisco has removed a backdoor account from its Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM), which would have allowed remote attackers to log in to unpatched devices with root privileges. [...]

item.title: Citrix warns of login issues after NetScaler auth bypass patch
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Citrix warns that patching recently disclosed vulnerabilities that can be exploited to bypass authentication and launch denial-of-service attacks may also break login pages on NetScaler ADC and Gateway appliances. [...]

item.title: Forminator plugin flaw exposes WordPress sites to takeover attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Forminator plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to an unauthenticated arbitrary file deletion flaw that could enable full site takeover attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes ‘Print to PDF’ feature broken by Windows update
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known bug that breaks the 'Print to PDF' feature on Windows 11 24H2 systems after installing the April 2025 preview update. [...]

item.title: Dozens of fake wallet add-ons flood Firefox store to drain crypto
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: More than 40 fake extensions in Firefox's official add-ons store are impersonating popular cryptocurrency wallets from trusted providers to steal wallet credentials and sensitive data. [...]

item.title: Grok 4 spotted ahead of launch with special coding features
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Elon Musk-funded xAI is skipping Grok 3.5 and releasing Grok 4 after Independence Day in the United States. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: DNS issue blocks delivery of Exchange Online OTP codes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is working to fix a DNS misconfiguration that is causing one-time passcode (OTP) message delivery failures in Exchange Online for some users. [...]

item.title: Qantas discloses cyberattack amid Scattered Spider aviation breaches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Australian airline Qantas disclosed that it detected a cyberattack on Monday after threat actors gained access to a third-party platform containing customer data. [...]
